name: Bleak
descriptions: Bleak is a slave being held at Paradise Falls in Fallout 3.

Bleak is a slave that continuously plans her escape from Paradise Falls, spending her days memorizing the slavers' patrols and routine in hopes of using it to her advantage. Ultimately, it rests upon her shoulders to carry out the breakout as she actively works towards it, and has both a sober mind and the will to escape.
Bleak can be found at the Paradise Falls slave house for the entire day.

Xbox 360 Despite any efforts to free Bleak or make her leave the compound (which include killing all the slavers in Paradise Falls), she may remain in the holding cell repeating phrases like "I've got to get out of here" and is seemingly unaware that she is no longer obstructed from leaving (this may sometimes occur if the Rescue from Paradise quest has already been completed).

topics.topic_text: The gate's open. Run for it!

topics.response_text: I'm watching the patrols, what do you think I'm looking at?

conversation.response_text: Keep your voice down, old man. Listen, if you're not part of the solution, then you're part of the problem. Help or shut up.
I don't care, Breadbox. I'm getting out of here. Stay if you want, just keep out of my way, or I'll assume that you're with them.
You got the right one this time? Are you serious? Here, let me see. Hand it to me.
What the-? Dammit Bronson! This isn't what I asked for! I needed one of the detonators not... whatever this is!
How many times have we gone over this, Bronson? Can't you stay sober enough to do one little thing?
I suppose I can do that. Just don't let me down again, Bronson. I need your help.
Are you serious? You want to die here? In this place? An old good for nothing slave? I mean come on, there so much more to...
All right, all right. You know where to find me if you change your mind.
That deal we made, we're still square, right? You know what you need to do?
Good, Bronson. Don't let me down.
